## Steps to reproduce
Write an error using the Write-Error cmdlet, passing [System.Management.Automation.ErrorRecord] where the CategoryInfo.Activity value is defined. (In the case of a cmdlet, this prevents the Activity from being labelled with the name of the cmdlet.)
```powershell
using namespace System.Management.Automation;
function Invoke-Error1 {
    [CmdletBinding()]
    param() 
    process {
        $ex = [InvalidOperationException]::new()
        $er = [ErrorRecord]::new($ex, 'OperationTest', [ErrorCategory]::InvalidOperation, 'MyErrorTarget')
        $er.CategoryInfo.Activity = 'MyActivity'
        Write-Error -ErrorRecord $er
    }
}

PS:\> Invoke-Error1
PS:\> Get-Error | Select CategoryInfo
```

## Expected behavior
The Activity of the CategoryInfo of the ErrorRecord should be "MyActivity".
```none
CategoryInfo
------------
InvalidOperation: (MyErrorTarget:String) [MyActivity], InvalidOperationException
```

## Actual behavior
Instead, the CategoryInfo.Activity value was overwritten by the `Write-Error` cmdlet. Note that this behavior is not repeated if you define the `CategoryActivity` parameter of `Write-Error` explicitly.
```none
CategoryInfo
------------
InvalidOperation: (MyErrorTarget:String) [Write-Error], InvalidOperationException
```

This was initially reported on [this stack exchange question](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/66751961/powershell-errorrecord-categoryinfo-activity-categoryactivity/).

title: Write-Error -ErrorRecord ignores ErrorRecord.CategoryInfo.Activity
